DataElement.preferredName: Patient Microsatellitosis AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th Edition Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether the patient meets the eligibility criteria for participating in a clinical trial with regards to microsatellitosis as defined by the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th Edition.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Microsatellitosis AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th Edition Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._One or more discontinuous nests of melanoma cells measuring at least 0.3 mm in diameter and separated from the primary lesion by more than 0.05 mm of normal tissue._The 8th edition of the criteria developed by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC), implemented in 2018, used for the classification and staging of neoplastic diseases._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Microsatellitosis AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th Edition Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: One or more discontinuous nests of melanoma cells measuring at least 0.3 mm in diameter and separated from the primary lesion by more than 0.05 mm of normal tissue.:The 8th edition of the criteria developed by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC), implemented in 2018, used for the classification and staging of neoplastic diseases.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: One or more discontinuous nests of melanoma cells measuring at least 0.3 mm in diameter and separated from the primary lesion by more than 0.05 mm of normal tissue.
The 8th edition of the criteria developed by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC), implemented in 2018, used for the classification and staging of neoplastic diseases.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
